isis.stitle: POWER STEERING PUMP: EATON MODEL BB135 R, L - ASSEMBLE - INTEGRAL RESERVOIR

step1.para: Assemble new seals into the four grooves on the reservoir mounting pad ( Figure 29).
Assemble a new O-ring into the groove on the reservoir stud.

Note the four hole pattern in the bottom of the reservoir and reinforcement plate, and align holes with the pump reservoir pad, making certain that the intake vent is piloted into one hole and that all four seals remain in position. Assemble reservoir and reinforcement plate inside the reservoir to the body with two 5/16-18 bolts and one 3/4-16 stud.
Pilot the filter element onto the stud and push down over the seal.
Assemble the filter cap onto the 5/16-18 stud using care not to damage the sealing lip.
Assemble the filter stud through the filter I.D. and thread into the reservoir stud and tighten to 5 ft-lbs. (6.7 Nm). The filter cap must pilot and locate in the filter I.D. when properly assembled.
Assemble the filter relief spring over the stud and onto the filter cap.
Assemble the reservoir cover over the stud and compress the filter relief spring while assembling seal washer and wing nut onto stud.
Align cover lip and reservoir O.D. to insure cover seal contact and tighten wing nut to 25 in-lbs. (2.8 Nm). Replace filler cap.

Install the Woodruff drive key in the pump shaft. Make sure Woodruff key remains in shaft slot. Install the pulley or drive gear. The pulley or gear is a slip fit on the shaft except for the last 1/4 inch of engagement, which is a slight press fit. Use the pulley bolt and washer assembly to pull the pulley "home." Tighten pulley bolt to 20 ft-lbs. (27 Nm).
Replace O-ring seals onto pressure and return lines before attaching to pump.
